author: N/A
title: The Old Testament
comments: Incredibly boring and of little value to me. Only books I'd revisit would be proverbs and Eclesiastes.

author: John Yates
title: The Mind Illuminated
comments: Halfway reading it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: The meditations of Marcus Aurelius
comments: Incredible paralelisms with budism. The beauty of stoicism in understanding life, and centering yourself on what really matters. How current this book is, and how sad that is with regards to the evolution of humanity's understanding of life.

author: James Allen
title: As a man thinketh
comments: Very good, down to the basics manual for life.

author: David Kahneman
title: Thinking Fast and Slow
comments: Super-interesting. Most widely applicable being part 1. A bit slow on the reading as its dense and longwinded, but worth every bit of information.

author: Teresa de Avila
title: Camino de Perfección
comments: Un poco redicho y antiguo el lenguaje. Pero muy interesante, ver cómo lideraba Sta Teresa, y cómo se parece a la meditación. La importancia de la humildad, y su lectura del Padre Nuestro.

author: Sharon L. Bowman
title: Training from the back of the room
Deliberate Calm - How to lead and learn in a volatile world

author: Paul Auster
comments: Precioso libro, magistralmente escrito, con el marco de la américa (NY) de los años 60, 70, 80. Una maravilla para disfrutar.

author: Homer
title: La Iliada
comments: A must read, second time around.

author: Homer
title: La Odisea
comments: A must read, second time around.

author: Joseph Heller
title: Catch22
comments: Beautiful book, starts hilarious and non-sensical, and starts showing the drama of war, its effect on people, and the desertion of the state to its soldiers.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: For whom the bell tolls
comments: Beautifully writen, also a good look into our recen Spanish history. The senseless war, brutality, love, and beautiful narration.

author: Jordan Peterson
title: 12 rules for life
comments: Nice set of rules and beautiful essays within touching on tangent points. A bit too heavy on the religious catholic background, but its substantiated and correct without falling too much on using it as a crutch to support his way of thinking.

author: Nemo Vaszi
title: Make it stick
comments: https://www.amazon.com/Make-Stick-Peter-Brown-Paperback/dp/B0CCCMPBV8?crid=UF39P2MHJ7C5&keywords=make+it+stick&qid=1690839988&sprefix=make+it+stick,aps,164&sr=8-1&linkCode=sl1&tag=flickthrough-20&linkId=e80c65c0853f6383b3db52c45cfaf0c1&language=en_US&ref_=as_li_ss_tl

author: Allen Downey
title: Think Stats 2
comments: https://greenteapress.com/thinkstats2/html

author: Dante Allighieri
title: La divina comedia
comments: Es realmente sorprendente cómo está hecho, y los temas que toca así como la forma de abordarlos. Sin embargo sin ser un gran conocedor de la historia del renacimiento italiano ni un gran conocedor de teología cristiana, se hace un poco árido. También pierde claramente con las traducciones.

author: Yuval Noah Harari
title: Sapiens: A brief history of humankind
comments: Explora hipotesis de las razones detrás de los mayores cambios en la historia de la humanidad. Cómo las construcciones mentales han sido el centro que ha permitido a la humanidad crear agrupaciones cada vez mayores, dentro de estos constructos, la religión, el capitalismo, la ciencia y su interrelación.

author: Jared Diamond
title: Why sex is fun? The evolution of human sexuality

author: Jared Diamon
title: Guns, Germs and Steel: The fate of human societies

author: Seneca
title: El libro de Oro
comments: Libro que recoge muchas frases cortas de la sabiduría de Seneca. Mucho para aprovechar.

author: Michael Wisehart
title: Aldoran Chronicles 3 - The 4 part key
comments: Dejo la serie es demasiado infantil.

author: James Clear
title: Atomic Habits - Tiny Changes for Remarkable Results

author: Jose Luis Corral
title: Independencia
comments: Libro interesantillo por lo que toca la historia de Zaragoza, pero póbremente escrito con muy muy poco gancho

author: Jidu Krishnamurti
title: Freedom from the Known
comments: Very deep and good book, but difficult to really follow forcing you to think rather than giving answers.

author: Jidu Krishnamurti
title: Descubrir lo Inmensurable (Talks in Germany)
comments: Very nice book on the observations of JK, how to move from the known and what is needed to be able to perceive what there is of "godlike" or Religious in us. A process of observation, and freedom from conditioning external and internal.

author: Nnedi Okorafor
title: Binty Trilogy
comments: Nice and entertaining novel, full of imagination and easy to read.

author: Ajahn Chah
title: Food for the heart
comments: About budism and its practice. Beautiful book to learn in a very clear way what the practice is. Clear guidance and counsel

author: Tamas Bodzsar
title: The Rhythm Code
comments: Learning about music rhythm, a system to understanding rhythm

author: Kosho Uchiyama
title: Opening the hand of thought
comments: Zazen learning

author: Brandon Sanderson
title: Wind and Truth - Book 5 Stormlight archive
comments: Fantasy, fiction novel

author: Ursula K. LeGuin
title: A wizard of Earthsea
comments: Rereading a classic of fantasy

author: Ursula K. LeGuin
title: The tombs of Atuan
comments: Rereading a classic of fantasy

author: Ursula K. LeGuin
title: The Farthest shore
comments: Rereading a classic of fantasy

author: Rupert Spira
title: Being aware of being aware
comments: Meditation, awareness, good book explaining to occidentals what awareness is and its characteristics

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
title: Miracle of Mindfulness
comments: Rereading this book. Meditation learning, perhaps one of the best books I have read on this.

author: Sam Harris
title: Waking Up: A Guide to Spirituality Without Religion
comments: Secular meditation and consciousness exploration. Great balance of science and insight.

author: Michael A. Singer
title: The Untethered Soul
comments: Gentle but deep dive into awareness, thought observation, and emotional freedom.

author: Ichiro Kishimi & Fumitake Koga
title: The Courage to Be Disliked
comments: Dialogued format exploring freedom, acceptance, and personal responsibility.

author: Seneca
title: Letters from a Stoic
comments: More personal and emotionally rich than Cicero. Ideal for daily philosophical reflection.

author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
title: Wherever You Go, There You Are
comments: Secular, poetic, and accessible introduction to mindfulness in everyday life.

author: Viktor Frankl
title: Man’s Search for Meaning
comments: Short and powerful; blends psychology, suffering, and purpose. A modern classic.

author: Ryan Holiday
title: The Obstacle is the Way
comments: Modern take on Stoicism; clear, actionable, and motivating. A natural follow-up to Meditations and Peterson.
